channel.title: Someone please help me. :\

item.title: Someone please help me. :\
item.dc:creator: @PloxScape PloxScape
item.description:
@PloxScape wrote:

[center]Hello users!

A lot of my players wanting to join my server can’t get on the server. I know why. But I don’t know how to fix the problem. Hopefully you guys can help me out!

Yes, the server is in fact online!

But I’m having a problem connecting with MY client that I use. I actually messed up my IP addresses A LOT.

Do you know what the IPs should be set to for myself?

NOTE: The server won’t be playable by anyone until I’m able to fix these issues!

[center]In my “server source” folder and my “client” folder I use, the IPs are all mixed around, and I’m not sure what to change them to.[/center]

The below IP addresses that need to be changed to the correct IPs are bolded so you can see them.

NOTICE: The IPs I’m showing you MUST be changed to either MY IP address, the SERVER’S IP address, or 127.0.0.1.[/center]

[center]----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------[/center]

[center]In my server.java file, located in my “server source” folder, my IP is coded like this:[/center]

().getHostName(); if ( /* * connectingHost.startsWith("localhost") || * connectingHost.equals("[b]127.0.0.1[/b]")

[center]And also, still in the “server source” file, my IPs are listed as follows in my client.java file:[/center]

[center]First messed up IP address:[/center]

public int GetWorld(int PlayerID) { String Server = PlayerHandler.players[PlayerID].playerServer; 
  if (Server.equals("[b]ploxscape.no-ip.org[/b]") || Server.equals("localhost")) {</blockquote>

[center]Second messed up IP address:[/center]

playerServer = inStream.readString(); } catch (Exception e) { playerServer = "[b]ploxscape.no-ip.org[/b]";

[center]Third messed up IP address:[/center]

if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("delta") && !connectedFrom.equals("[b]ploxscape.no-ip.org[/b]") && !connectedFrom.startsWith("adsl-99")){ println("Not from localhost!");

[center]And that is all that is messed up with my server source files. Remember, those IP addresses are set up in my server.java file and my client.java file in my SOURCE folder![/center]

[center]----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------[/center]

[center]Moving on, the next thing that is messed up is in MY actual “client” folder that I use to play on the server.[/center]

[center]The following IPs are set incorrectly and need to be changed, but I don’t know to what:[/center]

[center]In my “Gui.java” folder:[/center]

System.out.println("Connecting to update server"); Serverip = "[b]ploxscape.no-ip.org[/b]";

[center]And that is the only one that’s messed up in my “Gui.java” folder.[/center]

[center]And the LAST file that has messed up IPs addresses is called “client.java” and the IPs must be changed on this too![/center]

[center]“Client.java” server IP that is messed up 1:[/center]

signlink.startpriv(InetAddress.getLocalHost()); setserver("[b]127.0.0.1[/b]", "43594"); method2(503, false, 765);

[center]And then, the very last one:[/center]

aBoolean1153 = false; aBoolean1157 = false; aBoolean1158 = false; aBoolean1159 = false; aBoolean1160 = false; anInt1171 = 1; aString1173 = ""; aString1174 = ""; server = "[b]127.0.0.1[/b]";

[center]If you, or ANYONE, could potentially help me out with switching the IP’s to their correct IP address so everyone could play the server, I’d appreciate it so much!

Thank you for your time!

PloxScape[/center]

Read full topic
